values.description:
the bottle builder scripts were only willing to push to the `osrfbuild` github account. I just built bottles in a [pull request](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/238/commits) from the `osrf` repo, and it failed to update the hashes:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/145/

but this branch fixes it:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/146/

If the `PULL_REQUEST_HEAD_REPO` variable is not set before calling `_homebrew_github_setup.bash` it will default to the `osrfbuild` repo, so make sure to set the target before calling that script.
values.title: push to non-osrfbuild heads for brew pull requests

summary.raw:
the bottle builder scripts were only willing to push to the `osrfbuild` github account. I just built bottles in a [pull request](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/238/commits) from the `osrf` repo, and it failed to update the hashes:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/145/

but this branch fixes it:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/146/

If the `PULL_REQUEST_HEAD_REPO` variable is not set before calling `_homebrew_github_setup.bash` it will default to the `osrfbuild` repo, so make sure to set the target before calling that script.
summary.html:
the bottle builder scripts were only willing to push to the osrfbuild github account. I just built bottles in a pull request from the osrf repo, and it failed to update the hashes:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/145/

but this branch fixes it:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/146/

If the PULL_REQUEST_HEAD_REPO variable is not set before calling _homebrew_github_setup.bash it will default to the osrfbuild repo, so make sure to set the target before calling that script.

values.description:
This reverts one line of pull request #403 that enabled pushing updates to bottle pull requests that didn't originate from `osrfbuild`. We can still assume that pull requests will be originated from `osrfbuild` though.

* broken build: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/148/

* fixed build with this branch: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/149/
values.title: still create pull requests from osrfbuild account

summary.raw:
This reverts one line of pull request #403 that enabled pushing updates to bottle pull requests that didn't originate from `osrfbuild`. We can still assume that pull requests will be originated from `osrfbuild` though.

* broken build: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/148/

* fixed build with this branch: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/149/
summary.html:

values.description:
Current gazebo8 ros packages for Kinetic are broken and the current scripts [were not able to detect it](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/75/). I've fixed the bug in this PR and now the [script is failing as I it should](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/77/).

I've also notice that we were not testing the official gazebo-ros-pkgs version and also added them in this PR to check that [they are working properly](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/)
values.title: Fix and improve gazebo_ros_pkgs testing scripts

summary.raw:
Current gazebo8 ros packages for Kinetic are broken and the current scripts [were not able to detect it](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/75/). I've fixed the bug in this PR and now the [script is failing as I it should](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/77/).

I've also notice that we were not testing the official gazebo-ros-pkgs version and also added them in this PR to check that [they are working properly](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/)
summary.html:
Current gazebo8 ros packages for Kinetic are broken and the current scripts were not able to detect it. I've fixed the bug in this PR and now the script is failing as I it should.

I've also notice that we were not testing the official gazebo-ros-pkgs version and also added them in this PR to check that they are working properly

values.description:
gazebo debbuild failed on zesty since `locale-gen` wasn't found

this will install it on all ubuntu distros. I think this is ok, since it has existed since trusty:

* https://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/locales

but please double-check

values.description:
This is a resuscitation of a branch made by @\_jrivero_ that works with [gazebo branch fix_configure_win](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/branch/fix_configure_win).

It lets gazebo configure properly, but it fails to build:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/1689/console

Also, I had to delete the `workspace` folder on the jenkins node for the `ci-pr_any-windows7` job in order for the qt5 files to download. We'll probably have to manually do something for each jenkins job that needs a refreshed workspace folder.
values.title: Fix gazebo windows build

summary.raw:
This is a resuscitation of a branch made by @\_jrivero_ that works with [gazebo branch fix_configure_win](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/branch/fix_configure_win).

It lets gazebo configure properly, but it fails to build:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/1689/console

Also, I had to delete the `workspace` folder on the jenkins node for the `ci-pr_any-windows7` job in order for the qt5 files to download. We'll probably have to manually do something for each jenkins job that needs a refreshed workspace folder.
summary.html:
This is a resuscitation of a branch made by @_jrivero_ that works with gazebo branch fix_configure_win.

It lets gazebo configure properly, but it fails to build:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/1689/console

Also, I had to delete the workspace folder on the jenkins node for the ci-pr_any-windows7 job in order for the qt5 files to download. We'll probably have to manually do something for each jenkins job that needs a refreshed workspace folder.

Move the gazebo experimental default value check to the dependencies archive. Remove other support spread across different scripts.

And keep the gazebo experimental with the right dependencies (althoug failing due to other problems): https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo_experimental-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/9/console

values.description:
A recent [homebrew pull request](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/14408) does not provide the `pip` command with the `python` formula, but it is renamed as `pip2`. This caused a [build failure](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/246/):

~~~
++ pip install lxml
./scripts/jenkins-scripts/lib/project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bash: line 74: pip: command not found
~~~

A [test build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/247) has passed this step successfully.
values.title: use pip2 on brew, since homebrew python only links a versioned binary

summary.raw:
A recent [homebrew pull request](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/14408) does not provide the `pip` command with the `python` formula, but it is renamed as `pip2`. This caused a [build failure](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/246/):

~~~
++ pip install lxml
./scripts/jenkins-scripts/lib/project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bash: line 74: pip: command not found
~~~

A [test build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/247) has passed this step successfully.
summary.html:
A recent homebrew pull request does not provide the pip command with the python formula, but it is renamed as pip2. This caused a build failure:

++ pip install lxml
./scripts/jenkins-scripts/lib/project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bash: line 74: pip: command not found

A test build has passed this step successfully.

values.description:
Set `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` to false when not building tests, this doesn't work for all projects, sdformat for example doesn't take it.

Also moved ign-common to be built before ign-gui, because gui depends on it.
values.title: Don't build tests for dependencies

summary.raw:
Set `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` to false when not building tests, this doesn't work for all projects, sdformat for example doesn't take it.

Also moved ign-common to be built before ign-gui, because gui depends on it.
summary.html:
Set ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION to false when not building tests, this doesn't work for all projects, sdformat for example doesn't take it.

Also moved ign-common to be built before ign-gui, because gui depends on it.

values.description:
Include the base of code for handling Drake jobs:

 * Dependencies in the archive
 * Jenkins DSL: to generate the debbuild job (still untested) and the [CI building job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/drake-ci-default-xenial-amd64/11) on our release repository
 * Basic base drake job for compilations

values.description: Although we are not going to generate or host a Drake .deb by now I prefer to have the code in the default branch so we don't to lose it in branches. This PR adds the support to generate a big fat deb for Drake. Tested here: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/drake-debbuilder/52
values.title: Drake debbuilder implementation

summary.raw: Although we are not going to generate or host a Drake .deb by now I prefer to have the code in the default branch so we don't to lose it in branches. values.description:
Add two new test jobs generated by the DSL:

 * default_ROS+MoveIt+Navstak: install Drake dependencies (using the install_preps.sh script) + the navigation stack + MoveIt. Tested [here](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/drake-ci-default_ROS+MoveIt+Navstak-kinetic-xenial-amd64/11/consoleFull#console-section-6).
 * install-ROS+MoveIt+Navstak: just install ROS desktop, navigation stack and MoveIt. Useful to get the full list of packages installed. Tested [here](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/drake-install-ROS+MoveIt+Navstak-kinetic-xenial-amd64/4/).
values.title: Drake install test jobs

summary.raw:
Add two new test jobs generated by the DSL:

 * default_ROS+MoveIt+Navstak: install Drake dependencies (using the install_preps.sh script) + the navigation stack + MoveIt. Tested [here](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/drake-ci-default_ROS+MoveIt+Navstak-kinetic-xenial-amd64/11/consoleFull#console-section-6).
 * install-ROS+MoveIt+Navstak: just install ROS desktop, navigation stack and MoveIt. Useful to get the full list of packages installed. Tested [here](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/drake-install-ROS+MoveIt+Navstak-kinetic-xenial-amd64/4/).
summary.html:
Add two new test jobs generated by the DSL:

  • default_ROS+MoveIt+Navstak: install Drake dependencies (using the install_preps.sh script) + the navigation stack + MoveIt. Tested here.
  • install-ROS+MoveIt+Navstak: just install ROS desktop, navigation stack and MoveIt. Useful to get the full list of packages installed. Tested here.

values.description: The buildfarm has shown these last week problems with the key server. This PR changes the keyserver to use the one hosted by Ubuntu.
values.title: Change scripts to use the Ubuntu keyserver

summary.raw: The buildfarm has shown these last week problems with the key server. This PR changes the keyserver to use the one hosted by Ubuntu.
summary.html: The buildfarm has shown these last week problems with the key server. This PR changes the keyserver to use the one hosted by Ubuntu.

values.description:
We are putting more time and effort into our dart interface in gazebo, so I think we could install the dart packages for gazebo CI jobs. Tested here:

* [gazebo7](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboRelease/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/39/)
* [gazebo8](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/43/) has a couple test failures that will be disabled in [gazebo PR 2771](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2771/disable-broken-dart5-tests-on-gazebo8/diff)
* [default](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/282/)
values.title: Install dart packages for gazebo CI on Ubuntu

summary.raw:
We are putting more time and effort into our dart interface in gazebo, so I think we could install the dart packages for gazebo CI jobs. Tested here:

* [gazebo7](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboRelease/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/39/)
* [gazebo8](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/43/) has a couple test failures that will be disabled in [gazebo PR 2771](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2771/disable-broken-dart5-tests-on-gazebo8/diff)
* [default](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/282/)
summary.html:
We are putting more time and effort into our dart interface in gazebo, so I think we could install the dart packages for gazebo CI jobs. Tested here:

  • gazebo7
  • gazebo8 has a couple test failures that will be disabled in gazebo PR 2771
  • default

values.description:
I had submitted a broken pull request #356, and it got merged prematurely, so I reverted part of it in e700c94 and have fixed it again in this branch. The problem was using the `${SCRIPTS}` variable after changing folders, since that variable holds a relative path. I used a path relative to the `${WORKSPACE}` and that fixed my problem.

test builds:

* passed: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_math-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/85/
* pending: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-homebrew-amd64/57/
values.title: Fix rerun_failed script path (pull request #356)

values.description:
* Added jobs to test the ABI from different eigen versions
* Support for specific branches in the -any- job (designed to be integrated with PRs mechanism)

Jobs generated:

* ABI checking for [two eigen vesions](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/eigen3-abichecker-333_to_33beta1-xenial-amd64/)
* ABI checking [PCL with two eigen versions](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/pcl_eigen3-abichecker-333_to_33beta1-xenial-amd64) 
* [Drake build, install, test \+ particle test](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/drake-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/)

values.description: I noticed that we [don't have CI jobs for the ignition release branches](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/), so I've tried adding some to the DSL. I believe this only adds them for Linux, but we can expand it to homebrew and windows if it works.
values.title: Add ci jobs for ignition release branches, starting with Linux

summary.raw: I noticed that we [don't have CI jobs for the ignition release branches](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/), so I've tried adding some to the DSL. I believe this only adds them for Linux, but we can expand it to homebrew and windows if it works.
summary.html: I noticed that we don't have CI jobs for the ignition release branches, so I've tried adding some to the DSL. I believe this only adds them for Linux, but we can expand it to homebrew and windows if it works.

values.description:
We've been having trouble specifying the location of the `hg` tool on homebrew machines. It just doesn't want to find it in `/usr/local` (#93). I think this will fix it, by telling each brew job to use a mercurial installation named `HomeBrew` that was created in the global tool configuration for jenkins.

fix inspired by this post: https://stackoverflow.com/a/39380081
values.title: Fix mercurial location in brew jobs

summary.raw:
We've been having trouble specifying the location of the `hg` tool on homebrew machines. It just doesn't want to find it in `/usr/local` (#93). I think this will fix it, by telling each brew job to use a mercurial installation named `HomeBrew` that was created in the global tool configuration for jenkins.

fix inspired by this post: https://stackoverflow.com/a/39380081
summary.html:
We've been having trouble specifying the location of the hg tool on homebrew machines. It just doesn't want to find it in /usr/local (#93). I think this will fix it, by telling each brew job to use a mercurial installation named HomeBrew that was created in the global tool configuration for jenkins.

fix inspired by this post: https://stackoverflow.com/a/39380081

values.description: Sometimes mercurial gets uninstalled on homebrew systems, leading to build failures that require manual intervention on the machine. I tried working around this in pull request #411 using curl, but I think this might be a better solution if the brew tool works during this phase.
values.title: Try to brew install hg if it can't be found

summary.raw: Sometimes mercurial gets uninstalled on homebrew systems, leading to build failures that require manual intervention on the machine. I tried working around this in pull request #411 using curl, but I think this might be a better solution if the brew tool works during this phase.
